events.details: Fnatic wins pistol - derke gets 3k with Sheriff
Full buy advantage, clean round
PRX force buy works! Jinggg Raze satchels in for 4k ace
Paper Rex full buy, execute A site perfectly
Boaster clutches 1v3 on B site with Breach stun
Leo Sova utility control shuts down PRX push
Something op picks get 3 opening kills on defense
PRX saves, time expires
PRX retakes B site 4v4 post-plant
Fnatic fake A, rush C, plant and hold
Derke Jett op dominates long angles
PRX wins with spectre and ghost guns!
Fnatic leads 7-5 at half on attack
PRX wins second pistol with Jinggg 4k
PRX wins 3 straight rounds with full buys, momentum shift
Fnatic calls timeout down 7-9
Timeout works! Fnatic wins crucial round with new strat
Fnatic ties it up 9-9, Alfajer clutches 1v2
Fnatic takes lead! Chronicle Omen smokes deny retake
PRX force buy fails, Fnatic 2 away from map win
PRX keeps it alive with perfect execute
FNATIC WINS! Derke gets 3k to close map

commentary:
This Haven map between Fnatic and Paper Rex showcased tactical Valorant at its finest. Fnatic started strong on attack, taking the first pistol and building a 7-5 halftime lead behind derke's exceptional Jett OP play.

Paper Rex came alive in the second half, winning the pistol round and riding that momentum to a 9-7 lead. Jinggg's aggressive Raze play constantly caught Fnatic off-guard, and Paper Rex's coordinated site executes were nearly flawless.

The critical moment came at round 17 when Fnatic, down 7-9, called their final timeout. Whatever Boaster said workedâ€”Fnatic won 5 of the next 6 rounds to close out the map 12-10.

Key factors in Fnatic's victory: Leo's Sova utility control that consistently revealed PRX positions, Chronicle's Omen smokes that denied crucial retakes, and Alfajer's clutch plays in critical moments. Derke's 3k in the final round sealed the deal.

Paper Rex showed why they're feared with their aggressive, unpredictable playstyle, but Fnatic's discipline and tactical adjustments proved superior in this match.
